name: LGBT Terms
description: Short comprehensive list of LGBT terms

Sex.val: A medical term used to refer to the chromosomal, hormonal and anatomical characteristics that are used to classify an individual as female or male or intersex.
Someone whose combination of chromosomes, gonads, hormones, internal sex organs, and genitals differs from the two expected patterns of male or female.
A term used by some medical professionals to refer to a group of surgical options that alter a person’s biological sex.

Gender.val: The idea that there are only two genders – male/female or man/woman and that a person must be strictly gendered as either/or
The external display of one’s gender, through a combination of dress, demeanor, social behavior, and other factors, generally measured on scales of masculinity and femininity.
Someone whose gender presentation, whether by nature or by choice, aligns with society’s gender-based expectations
A person whose gender identity and biological sex assigned at birth align (e.g., man and male-assigned)
The internal perception of an one’s gender
A catch-all term for gender identities other than man and woman, thus outside of the gender binary and cisnormativity (sometimes referred to as non-binary)
A person who lives as a member of a gender other than that expected based on anatomical sex

Sexuality.val: The type of sexual, romantic, physical, and/or spiritual attraction one feels for others, often labeled based on the gender.
The types of sexual intercourse, stimulation, and gratification one likes to receive and participate in.
Having a lack of (or low level of) sexual attraction to others and/or a lack of interest or desire for sex or sexual partners
A person who experiences sexual, romantic, physical, and/or spiritual attraction for members of all gender identities/expressions
Attracted to genderqueer and transsexual people and expressions (people who don’t identify as cisgender)
